quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Johnny Depp and Character
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, johny, festival. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the 1993 movie Whats Eating Gilbert Grape, Gilbert Grape is the name of the character played by Johnny Depp.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Johnny Depp publicly stated that he, in part, had based his portrayal of Captain Jack Sparrow in Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl on which musician?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Keith Richards

questions.question: When was Elvis born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: January 8, 1935

questions.question: He played Nicholas Bradford on the ultra popular 70s sitcom Eight is Enough.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adam Rich

questions.question: What is the first name of Johnny Depps character in the 2004 film Secret Window?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mort

questions.question: This Scottish author, portrayed by Johnny Depp in the movie Finding Neverland, created the fictional character Peter Pan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Barrie

questions.question: What type of festival is the Summerfest, held annually in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, US?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Music festival

questions.question: Who were Elviss parents?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gladys and Vernon

questions.question: What is Elviss mansion called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Graceland

questions.question: What town was Elvis born in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tupelo

questions.question: Johnny Depp played the role of Inspector Fred Abberline in what 2001 film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: From Hell

questions.question: What is the state bird of the U.S. state of Wisconsin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robin

questions.question: One of Johnny Depps earliest film roles was as Gator Lerner in what 1986 movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Platoon

questions.question: In the 2001 movie Blow, Johny Depps role is based on the real life story of his character.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these Tim Burton films, starring Johnny Depp, came first?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edward Scissorhands

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Actor and Actress

questions.question: Rapper turned actor Will Smith married this actress in 1997.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jada Pinkett

questions.question: Singer Jennifer Lopez married this famous singer in 2004.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Anthony

questions.question: This actor made his film debut in Rubberface and followed it with appearances in Copper Mountain, Once Bitten and Peggy Sue Got Married before he hit the big time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Carrey

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christine Taylor

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Sean Connery and Voice
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, cartoon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This TV and voice actor is from a Jewish family from Greece. He has had many voice roles (numerous characters on the The Simpsons, Eddie Brock in the Spider-Man animated series), several Emmys, and roles in many movies and TV shows.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hank Azaria

questions.question: You remember this actress voice from Mulan (Grandmother Fa), Cinderella (Lucifer the Cat) and The Smurfs (Jokey Smurf and Mother Nature). She was also Granny, the owner of Tweety and Sylvester the cat.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: June Foray

questions.question: Why was Sean Connerys service in the Navy shortened?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: stomach ulcer

questions.question: Sean Connery got tattoos while he was in the Navy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Sean Connery has done voice-over work in a video game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Paul is dead myth holds that Paul McCartney died on November 9, 1966.  Which of the following is not a clue suggesting that date?

options.text: The bass drum on the Sgt. Peppers album cover has a hidden message, visible by holding a mirror through the middle of the drum, indicating 11/9.
The lyrics of Shes Leaving Home include the line, Wednesday morning at five oclock, and November 9, 1966, was a Wednesday.
The repetition of number nine in the song Revolution 9 means November nine.
The Beatles had released nine albums by the time Paul supposedly died.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Beatles had released nine albums by the time Paul supposedly died.

questions.question: Which of these characters was voiced by Adriana Caselotti, an Italian-American actress of a musical family?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snow White

questions.question: To which of these animated films has popular American actress and voice artist, Mae Questel not contributed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Micky Mouse

questions.question: An elephant in Dumbo, the Queen of Hearts in Alice in Wonderland, and Flora in Sleeping Beauty were some of the best roles of this voice actress.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Verna Felton

questions.question: Sean Connery was offered a role in The Matrix but turned it down.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following James Bond movies, starring Sean Connery, was released first?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. No

questions.question: Richard Kiel, who is 72 tall, remains best known for which role in the James Bond movies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jaws

questions.question: This actor gave his voice to the popular animated cartoon cat Garfield. He was also known as the voice of Carlton, the doorman on the television comedy Rhoda, a spin-off of the Mary Tyler More Show.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lorenzo Music

questions.question: What of these was the last movie Sean Connery made?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
